MARCUS COHN
LEONARD H.MARKS
PAUL DOBIN
STANLEY S. NEUSTADT
STANLEY B.COHEN
LAW OFFICES
Cohn and Marks
CAFRITZ BUILDING
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
April 12, 1958
TELEPHONE
STERLING 3-5880
CABLE ADDRESS
COMAR-WASHINGTON, D. C.
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director, NAEB
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
I have your letter of April 8th.
The Senate Interstate and Foreign Commerce Committee
will give an opportunity to the opponents of the bill
to testify on April 14, 15 and 16 and then again in
the middle of May. It is my recommendation, in the
light of your and Burt's letter, that what we should
do, at this time, is request an opportunity to appear
at the May hearings. Will you please confirm our
authorization to make this request on behalf of the
NAEB. I agree with you that we should neither support
nor oppose the bill, at the hearing, but should merely
ask that the bill be amended so as to exclude licensees
